post.body: LOL, sounds like mostly fun. (Not a big FG/AD fan) I just went on a 3.6 mile walk, which helped clear the head some. :)
I would take action after 6 HOURS. You are crazy for going this long!
I'm not Jewish, and, well, I could relate more to that list! I actually like the BWE blog, but, I love watching The Soup.
Any breakfast item including the word "biscuits" has to be well worthwhile.
Avi, too bad there's no real way to bring in your DVR to the newsroom... you could get caught up!
BTW - Thanks for all the recent new followers! I appreciate you all, a lot.
Time to get ready and head into work.
Still stuffed from the TV8 potluck. Shoveling didn't burn those calories off.
Had lunch with @AvitheTVGeek today. Oddly enough, we DID talk about Law & Orders.
New frosting, plus chocolate chunks, completed my dessert. Maybe I'll sneak a bite tonight? :)
That recipe's frosting was dumb. Followed it to the letter and I got this cottage cheese-looking sauce. Powdered sugar couldn't save it.
I can finally say today that Rainbow Grill DOES have good breakfast. Still a Russ' fan (I work there), but, Grill does A.M. good, too.
Just have to make the frosting, and then let the dessert settle overnight. Baked coffee makes the kitchen smell SOO good!
Making a Tiramisu Cheesecake Bar dessert for tomorrow. Long time to make, but, well worthwhile. http://tinyurl.com/6zvahd
Spent the night cleaning my "home office". Maybe next week I'll do the journchat for a while. But, my cleaning itch had to be scratched!
To do on Tuesday: Send out e-mails to previous instructors, out to lunch, out at night for bowling. Lots of gaps in-between. Hhmm...
Cleaning out my home desk now (about 1/3 of my bedroom). Big bag filled up with papers to recycle.
1 of 2 closets is a whole lot lighter. Do not feel motivation to clean the other one, though. (But it needs it... a lot.)
Spending the day cleaning a closet (2 trash bags and 3 bags for Goodwill), while watching season 4 of Lost on DVD.
First Sunday night in a long time without any homework. It is unsettling. What did I do for fun? I'm not sure I know.
Beltline Bar's new restaurant opening in Muskegon, Alleyways, with ribbon-cutting ceremony on Monday.
Just tried to scrape ice off the driveway -- its 40 degrees! -- but its not enough to get it up. Too thick, too stuck on. Rats.
Great time as church nursery help this morning, then humbled by hearing people open up over their problems in sermon discussion group.
Potholes, flooding, ice, winds, snow... The morning drive to church could be very interesting!
Wait... they add an extra second on NYE/NYD? Could they have picked a more confusing time to do that? http://tinyurl.com/6vtbf4
Just drove through heavy fog, with electronica on the radio. It was like my own private, mobile rave party. (My first ever, incidentally.)
DUDE! I put in an url and twitter automatically condensed the link for me! And here I was, actually going to Tinyurl.com all the time.
50 things Jews do on Christmas: http://tinyurl.com/9c572t
Back from a long, stressful day at work. Everyone goes out to eat on the weekend after Christmas. EVERYONE.
At work until 8 or so. Will have to do some show prep when I get home, then hang w/fam & friends.
Spent Christmas night playing Apples to Apples, Dance Dance Revolution and The Office trivia game.
Family just went sledding at Johnson Park. Texas kin loved the experience... not the sore muscles & eventual bruising.
Some back roads tonight were slippery, but around 9:30, W I-196 from Fuller to Jenison was fine.Mostly dry, very few black ice spots.
Watched some episodes of The Office (US) on DVD with my Texas relatives. I love how simply, bluntly absurd it is.
If forecast stays true, then the best Christmas gift will be the gift of not having to shovel for a day!
Needs to take some headache medicine before going to church tonight.
I'm leaving my room now. Else I'll just keep tweeting for another hour.
HAHA!!! I just got a AIM spam from a "InventiveCoho", who said "Let's discuss Norse mythology!" So random. So odd. So very funny.
Most stressful Christmas Eve EVER, let me tell you...
